thread.title: Ben Carson's gun comments highlight free-wheeling style
thread.title_full: Ben Carson's gun comments highlight free-wheeling style - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Bill Barrow, Associated Press
title: Ben Carson's gun comments highlight free-wheeling style
text: Photo: Andrew Harnik, AP In this Oct. 9, 2015 photo, Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson speaks at a luncheon at the National Press Club in Washington. In the past week, Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson has suggested the Holocaust wouldn't have happened if Jews in Europe were better armed, said gun control is a bigger tragedy than a bullet-riddled body and that the best way to confront a mass shooter is to rush the gunman. In this Oct. 9, 2015 photo, Republican presidential candidate Dr.... LAWRENCEVILLE, Ga. (AP) — Ben Carson suggested last week the Holocaust wouldn't have happened if Jews in Europe were better armed. He argued that gun control is a bigger tragedy than a bullet-riddled body. He said the best way to confront a mass shooter is to rush the gunman. In this Oct. 9, 2015 photo, Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson speaks at a luncheon at the National Press Club in Washington. In the past week, Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson has suggested the Holocaust wouldn't have happened if Jews in Europe were better armed, said gun control is a bigger tragedy than a bullet-riddled body and that the best way to confront a mass shooter is to rush the gunman. In this Oct. 9, 2015 photo, Republican presidential candidate Dr.... LAWRENCEVILLE, Ga. (AP) — Ben Carson suggested last week the Holocaust wouldn't have happened if Jews in Europe were better armed. He argued that gun control is a bigger tragedy than a bullet-riddled body. He said the best way to confront a mass shooter is to rush the gunman.
